author: matttttttt1695
content: How does Ethereum check if two identical validators are voting for a block?

author: arnili
content: network participants can run a slasher https://docs.prylabs.network/docs/prysm-usage/slasher which collects all attestations and checks if they are slashable

author: matttttttt1695
content: so it's means no official mechanism to check double voting?

author: arnili
content: what's slashable is well defined and there are incentives to slash misbehaving validators, i think that's as official as it gets, ethereum has no reference implementation

author: arnili
content: if you mean checking from a validator point of view thats pretty simple: don't vote more than once per validator per epoch - EVER

author: arnili
content: i know from teku that it will simply write the highest epoch it ever attested to into a file and will only vote again for a later epoch

author: arnili
content: (you can also get slashed for trying to alter history but afaik this would need to be fabricated and an honest validator could never do this by accident)

author: sproul
content: the other slasher implementation is Lighthouse: <https://lighthouse-book.sigmaprime.io/slasher.html>
